text: Sinikka Marja-Liisa Keskitalo (29 January 1951 - 25 October 2011) was a female long-distance runner from Finland. She competed in the women's marathon for her native country at two consecutive Summer Olympics, starting in 1984. Her best result was the 15th place at the 1984 Summer Olympics in Los Angeles, California. She was born in Jalasjärvi. ==Achievements== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |1982 |European Championships |Athens, Greece |15th |Marathon |2:48:54 |- |1983 |World Championships |Helsinki, Finland |27th |Marathon |2:46:10 |- |1984 |Olympic Games |Los Angeles, United States |15th |Marathon |2:35:15 |- |1986 |European Championships |Stuttgart, West Germany |4th |Marathon |2:34:31 |- |1987 |World Championships |Rome, Italy |8th |Marathon |2:35:16 |- |1988 |Olympic Games |Seoul, South Korea |42nd |Marathon |2:43:00 |} ==References== * Sinikka Keskitalo's profile at Sports Reference.com * Sinikka Keskitalo's obituary Category:1951 births Category:2011 deaths Category:People from Jalasjärvi Category:Finnish female long-distance runners Category:Olympic athletes of Finland Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1984 Summer Olympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1988 Summer Olympics
title: Sinikka Keskitalo
